availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John T. G. Galt (Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and bookkeeper)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and bookkeeper. Kentucky native. Son of Norbone A. Galt and Elizabeth M. Gray Galt. Married to Martha E. Creel Galt in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 3, 1856. Clerk in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Bank clerk in Jefferson County in 1860. Employed Patrick McGuire as a gardener in Jefferson County in 1860. Bookkeeper for Quigley, Lyons, & Company in Louisville in 1861. Bookkeeper for Hunt, Morton, & Quigley in Louisville in 1865.
